stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· 440 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaaI0aGaaG inaiaaicdacaaMe8UaaeOBaiaab2gaaaa@3B8B@ . Photons with a wavelength of 440 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaaI0aGaaG inaiaaicdacaaMe8UaaeOBaiaab2gaaaa@3B8B@ have a higher frequency than those with a wavelength of 590 nm MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaaI1aGaaG yoaiaaicdacaaMe8UaaeOBaiaab2gaaaa@3B91@ because frequency and wavelength are inversely proportional (ν= c λ ) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaGGOaGaeqyVd4 Maeyypa0ZaaSaaaeaacaWGJbaabaGaeq4UdWgaaiaacMcaaaa@3FC0@ . Since frequency and energy are directly proportional (E=h ν) MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaGGOaGaamyrai abg2da9iaadIgacaaMc8UaeqyVd4Maaiykaaaa@4056@ , the higher frequency (shorter wavelength) photons have the greater energy.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Exothermic. The diagram shows that the absorbance, and therefore the concentration, of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaae iuaiaabkeaaaa@3844@ is greater at high temperature. The increased concentration of reactants at elevated temperature is consistent with an exothermic reaction, according to Le Châtelier’s principle.

The response provides both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· Exothermic. The diagram shows that the absorbance, and therefore the concentration, of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaae iuaiaabkeaaaa@3844@ is greater at high temperature. The increased concentration of reactants at elevated temperature is consistent with an exothermic reaction, according to Le Châtelier’s principle.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not correctly describe the effect of the error.

· The estimated molarity of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaae iuaiaabkeaaaa@3844@ would be too high. The fingerprint would scatter or absorb some of the incoming light, making the measured absorbance greater than it should be. Because absorbance and concentration are directly proportional, the greater absorbance would be misinterpreted as a concentration of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaae iuaiaabkeaaaa@3844@ that is higher than the actual concentration.

The response correctly describes the effect of the error.

· The estimated molarity of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaae iuaiaabkeaaaa@3844@ would be too high. The fingerprint would scatter or absorb some of the incoming light, making the measured absorbance greater than it should be. Because absorbance and concentration are directly proportional, the greater absorbance would be misinterpreted as a concentration of BPB MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGcbGaae iuaiaabkeaaaa@3844@ that is higher than the actual concentration.

title: Part H
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· When the concentration of OH − MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGpbGaaeisam aaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaaaa@3BB4@ increases, the collisions between reactant particles occur more frequently per unit of time. The greater frequency of collisions leads to an increased rate of product formation and correspondingly a shorter half-life of the reaction.

The response provides a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· When the concentration of OH − MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr 0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaqGpbGaaeisam aaCaaaleqabaGaeyOeI0caaaaa@3BB4@ increases, the collisions between reactant particles occur more frequently per unit of time. The greater frequency of collisions leads to an increased rate of product formation and correspondingly a shorter half-life of the reaction.

title: Part J
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid correction to the chemical quantities.

· To make a 2.00 M MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaaIYaGaai OlaiaaicdacaaIWaGaaGjbVlaad2eaaaa@3B28@ solution, the student needs to dissolve 80.0 g of NaOH (2.00 mol) in 1.00 L MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbf9v8qqaqFr0xc9pk 0xbba9q8WqFfea0=yr0RYxir=Jbba9q8aq0=yq=He9q8qqQ8frFve9 Fve9Ff0dmeaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaaI4aGaaG imaiaac6cacaaIWaGaaGjbVlaabEgacaqGGaGaae4BaiaabAgacaqG GaGaaeOtaiaabggacaqGpbGaaeisaiaaysW7caGGOaGaaGOmaiaac6 cacaaIWaGaaGimaiaaysW7caqGTbGaae4BaiaabYgacaGGPaGaaGjb VlaabMgacaqGUbGaaeiiaiaabgdacaqGUaGaaeimaiaabcdacaaMe8 Uaaeitaaaa@5513@ of solution.

title: Part L
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct choice and a valid justification equivalent to the following.

· The temperature change would be greater in solvent X than in water.
